DOC.brief_title: A Telephone Feedback System Prevention Chronic Pain Relapse
DOC.detailed_description: IVR ( Interactive Voice Response ) computer-based , automate telephone system enable caller respond record voice via telephone keypad . Using technology , therapeutic IVR ( TIVR ) develop tool provide maintenance treatment follow group cognitive-behavioral cop skill train ( CST ) , widely-used behavioral treatment chronic pain . TIVR four component : - automate daily questionnaire self-monitoring - review cop skill - guide behavioral rehearsal CST cop skill - personalize monthly feedback message record onto TIVR therapist All four component access remotely patient via touch-tone phone . In small pilot study , people severe , chronic musculoskeletal pain receive 11 week either CST alone CST TIVR access therapist feedback . Those used TIVR good pain outcomes . This study compare effectiveness TIVR without therapist feedback control group use TIVR . To eligible study , participant must complete 11-week course CST University Vermont College Medicine 's MindBody Medicine Clinic . At study entry , participant randomly assign one three group . Group 1 control group receive intervention study . Group 2 participant receive full access TIVR get minimal monthly message therapist , use participant 's daily questionnaire data . Group 3 participant receive full access TIVR get personalize monthly message therapist base participant 's daily questionnaire data . Messages participant include trend therapist note participant 's stress , sleep , mood , pain level , cop , activity , report TIVR . All study participant may continue receive treatment regular physician take part pain management technique study , treatment provide study . Upon complete 11 week CST , participant ask complete packet questionnaires chronic pain . At start study , participant Groups 2 3 30-minute training session use access TIVR . At Months 4 , 8 , 12 , participant three group follow-up interview complete additional questionnaire .
